overview_of_class: CHINESE 211 is a year-long intermediate-level course, designed to further develop students' communicative competence in listening, speaking, reading and writing in modern Chinese as well as to deepen understanding of Chinese culture and social issues. Student-centered communicative activities will follow instructor-led introduction to lesson vocabulary and grammar. Students will learn the use of the language for description and comparison. Students are expected to be able to read, write and discuss cultural, economic and social issues in addition to familiar daily life topics. Chinese is the means of instruction. Upon satisfactory completion of the whole sequence course, students are expected to reach Intermediate-High level of the ACTFL proficiency guidelines.
